long: Meaning: to set in a "row", i.e. "arrange", put in "order" (in a very wide variety of applications).  Usage: put (set) (the battle, self) in array, compare, direct, equal, esteem, estimate, expert (in war), furnish, handle, join (battle), ordain, (lay, put, reckon up, set) (in) order, prepare, tax, value.  Source: a primitive root;
